item.title: Coronavirus: Leicester lockdown tightened as cases rise
item.description: Non-essential shops will shut and schools will close for most pupils in the city, Matt Hancock says.

item.title: Coronavirus: PM pledges to 'build back better' post-virus
item.description: Boris Johnson will set out plans to "bring forward" Â£5bn of project investment as part of a "new deal".

item.title: Back-to-school safety plans for autumn in England leaked
item.description: Whole school years will be in separate "bubbles" when pupils go back in September, say leaked plans.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK hardest hit by virus among leading G7 nations
item.description: Analysis by the BBC shows Covid-19 deaths and excess deaths have been proportionately worse in the UK.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Worrying trend' of rising cases in Ireland
item.description: Ireland's chief medical officer urges people "not to go ahead" with bookings to travel abroad.

item.title: Coronavirus: Mandatory MOTs to be reintroduced from August
item.description: Vehicle owners have been able to delay the test for six months during lockdown.

item.title: Flu virus with 'pandemic potential' found in China
item.description: The new strain, scientists say, is carried by pigs but can infect humans and requires close monitoring.

item.title: Cirque du Soleil cuts 3,500 jobs to avoid bankruptcy
item.description: The group says the coronavirus pandemic has forced it to cancel shows and lay off its artists.

item.title: Coronavirus: New guidance for weddings in England
item.description: Ceremonies of up to 30 people can go ahead but big receptions, singing and food are not allowed.

item.title: Family rescue bear cub swimming with a jar stuck on its head
item.description: Tricia Hurt's family were fishing in Wisconsin when they spotted the animal in need of a helping hand.

item.title: Byron Burger lines up administrators as it seeks buyer
item.description: The burger chain wants some protection from creditors as it seeks a rescue deal.

item.title: Golden State Killer pleads guilty to 13 murders
item.description: Ex-policeman Joseph DeAngelo terrorised Californian communities in the 1970s and 80s.

item.title: Wirecard: Financial watchdog lifts restrictions on payments
item.description: Thousands of people were barred from using their cash cards because of the collapse of Wirecard.

item.title: The Papers: 'First local lockdown' and Johnson's 'New Deal'
item.description: The front pages cover the tightening of Covid restrictions in Leicester and plans to kick-start the UK economy.

item.title: Coronavirus: Choir song honours health and care workers who have died
item.description: Composer Howard Goodall's new song features the names of over a hundred NHS and care home workers who have died.

item.title: Coronavirus: Leicester residents and businesses react to lockdown plans
item.description: Pubs and restaurants in the city could remain closed for two extra weeks due to a spike in cases.

item.title: Coronavirus: The Ipswich salon where mum can work but daughter cannot
item.description: A mother and daughter air their frustration at new post-lockdown guidance affecting their salon.

item.title: Rankin portraits celebrate NHS workers during pandemic
item.description: Photographer Rankin photographed 12 people whose jobs have been critical during the pandemic.

item.title: Behind the scenes of Stormzy's Glastonbury set
item.description: How the creative directors of Stormzy's 2019 performance created a defining Glastonbury moment.

item.title: Gorton youth zone: 'It will make people proud to live here again'
item.description: Kids can get into trouble if thereâs nothing to do - could a new Â£6.6m centre be about to change that?

item.title: Post-War Paris through the eyes of photojournalist Paul Almasy
item.description: Photojournalist Paul Almasy documented the capital's glamorous streets, bars and cafes.

item.title: Coronavirus: Author Michael Rosen told he 'might not wake up' from coma
item.description: The We're Going On A Bear Hunt author spent nearly seven weeks on a ventilator while he had Covid-19.

item.title: Want to start cycling to work? Here's how
item.description: The Bikeability Trust's Paul Robison breaks down how to start cycling with confidence.

item.title: Brexit: Where are we now?
item.description: It's been out of the headlines for the past few months, but Brexit is back on the political menu.

item.title: Who needs Wimbledon? Strawberry sales soar
item.description: The cancellation of events like weddings and Wimbledon has not stopped strawberry sales soaring.

item.title: How tear gas became the go-to weapon for US police
item.description: The riot control agent has been banned in war for 100 years but remains a vital tool for police during protests.

item.title: Coronavirus: Ghana 'quack doctors' selling 'cure'
item.description: Investigative reporter Anas Aremeyaw Anas exposes a Covid-19 scam said to be worth thousands of dollars.

item.title: 'My struggle with racism in the Metropolitan police'
item.description: Former senior police officer Shabnam Chaudhri says she was unfairly treated, because of her ethnicity.

item.title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: A 'dying' patient's miraculous recovery
item.description: When Mohammed Azeem arrived in hospital his blood oxygen levels were "not compatible with life" as one doctor put it.

item.title: David Frost: Does it matter if the national security adviser is politically appointed?
item.description: Our security correspondent looks at the appointment of David Frost as an adviser to the prime minister.

item.title: How UK museums are responding to Black Lives Matter
item.description: With museums reopening in July, the return of looted cultural objects is in the spotlight again.

item.title: Could a boycott kill Facebook?
item.description: As Ford, Adidas, Microsoft and HP pause ads on the social network, should Facebook be worried?

item.title: How hackers extorted $1.14m from University of California, San Francisco
item.description: BBC News witnesses a negotiation between ransomware hackers and a 'cash-strapped' university.

item.title: Betelgeuse: Nearby 'supernova' star's dimming explained
item.description: Astronomers say big cool patches on the Betelgeuse star likely drove its surprise dimming last year.

item.title: 'Talking to my white friend about race - for the first time'
item.description: The Black Lives Matter protests that followed George Floyd's killing led one of Patrick George's white friends to ask him a question.

item.title: Coronavirus: Three surprising jobs you can do from home
item.description: Coronavirus has forced people to get creative with the way they work, with some surprising jobs going online.

item.title: Child poverty: Boris Johnson's claims fact-checked
item.description: The prime minister has made four claims on poverty, do the figures support them?

item.title: Is Becky Hill pop's biggest unknown star?
item.description: She's sung on dozens of chart hits but after eight years, people are only just starting to recognise her name.

item.title: 'My chronic acne inspired me to start my own skincare company'
item.description: How Michelle Doherty overcame her skin problems and launched skincare business Alpha-H.

item.title: Dyche 'committed and motivated' after Burnley boost European hopes
item.description: Burnley boss Sean Dyche says he remains committed to the club as they boost their hopes of qualifying for Europe with victory at Crystal Palace.

item.title: Northampton thump Exeter at empty Wembley to reach League One
item.description: Northampton Town win promotion at an empty Wembley as they ease past 10-man Exeter City in the League Two play-off final.

item.title: Derby's Wisdom in hospital after being stabbed in 'unprovoked assault and robbery'
item.description: Derby County defender Andre Wisdom is stable in hospital after being stabbed in an "unprovoked assault and robbery" in Liverpool.

item.title: Troy Deeney: Keep up the pressure against racism, says Watford captain
item.description: Watford striker Troy Deeney, a key organiser of the Premier League's Black Lives Matter support, says the next challenge is to keep up the pressure for change.

item.title: Mercedes decision to race in black cars for 2020 an 'important statement', says Hamilton
item.description: Mercedes will run a new black livery in Formula 1 in 2020 as a signal of their commitment to greater diversity and inclusion in motorsport.

item.title: Football commentators must address racial 'bias' says PFA
item.description: There is "evident bias" in some football commentary relating to the skin tone of players, according to a new study.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are Leicester's new lockdown restrictions?
item.description: The city is the first to experience a local lockdown as officials try to curb its coronavirus cases.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and lockdown rules?
item.description: Lockdown rules are changing so you can now meet people and carry out a wide range of activities.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are air bridges and which countries can I go to?
item.description: Britons will be able to travel to certain places without having to quarantine under new agreements.

item.title: Coronavirus: Has China or the US tested more?
item.description: China and the US both say they have done the most testing for coronavirus - so who's right?

item.title: Where in the world are coronavirus cases rising and falling?
item.description: As the world hits the grim milestone of 10 million confirmed cases, which countries are seeing the biggest rises, and what might be behind them?

item.title: Coronavirus: How would a local lockdown work in Leicester?
item.description: Parts of the country could introduce local lockdowns if cases of Covid-19 spike, but how might they work?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules on weddings?
item.description: Many weddings were cancelled during lockdown, while some will have to change to meet the new rules.

item.title: Coronavirus: How long does it take to recover?
item.description: Recovery from Covid-19 can be a lengthy process, depending on how seriously people get the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: What tests are being done in the UK?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: 'The love letter to my neighbourhood that helped me flee my country'
item.description: JosÃ© Gregorio MÃ¡rquez was ashamed of the place he grew up, but he came to love it before leaving it forever.
